verses.text: Every commandment that I command you today you must be careful to do, so that you may live and multiply and go in and possess the land that the LORD swore to your fathers.
verses.comment: ‘Commandment’ singular in Hebrew likely refers collectively to all the statutes.

verses.text: You shall remember all the way the LORD your God has led you these forty years in the wilderness, to humble you and test you, to know what was in your heart, whether you would keep His commandments or not.
verses.comment: ‘Test’ means to reveal genuine devotion and obedience.

verses.text: And He humbled you and let you hunger and fed you with manna, which you did not know, nor did your fathers know, that He might make you know that man does not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of the LORD.
verses.comment: Jesus quotes this in Matthew 4:4 in His temptation.

verses.text: Your clothing did not wear out upon you, and your foot did not swell these forty years.
verses.comment: This miraculous preservation is repeated later in Nehemiah 9:21.

verses.text: Know then in your heart that, as a man disciplines his son, so the LORD your God disciplines you.
verses.comment: See also Hebrews 12:5–6 and Proverbs 3:11–12 for the discipline theme.

verses.text: Therefore, you shall keep the commandments of the LORD your God, to walk in His ways and to fear Him.
verses.comment: ‘Walk in His ways’ is a Hebrew idiom for living faithfully.

verses.text: For the LORD your God is bringing you into a good land, a land of brooks of water, of fountains and springs, flowing out in valleys and hills;
verses.comment: Describing the prosperity and fertility of the promised land.

verses.text: A land of wheat and barley, of vines and fig trees and pomegranates, a land of olive oil and honey;
verses.comment: Listing seven staple products, symbolizing abundance.

verses.text: A land where you will eat bread without scarcity, you will lack nothing there; a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose hills you can dig copper.
verses.comment: Iron and copper: indication of economic resources in the land.

verses.text: And you shall eat and be full, and you shall bless the LORD your God for the good land He has given you.
verses.comment: Blessing God after a meal is a Jewish tradition rooted in this verse.

verses.text: Take care lest you forget the LORD your God, by not keeping His commandments and His judgments and His statutes that I command you today;
verses.comment: Warning against spiritual complacency after prosperity.

verses.text: Lest, when you have eaten and are full and have built good houses and live in them,
verses.comment: ‘Good houses’ directly echoes prior blessings.

verses.text: And when your herds and flocks multiply, and your silver and gold is multiplied, and all that you have is multiplied,
verses.comment: Multiplying possessions as a sign of blessing.

verses.text: Then your heart be lifted up, and you forget the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery;
verses.comment: ‘Lifted up’ is a Hebrew idiom for pride.

verses.text: Who led you through the great and terrifying wilderness, with fiery serpents and scorpions and thirsty ground where there was no water, who brought water for you out of the rock of flint;
verses.comment: ‘Fiery serpents’ refers to venomous snakes encountered in the wilderness.

verses.text: Who fed you in the wilderness with manna that your fathers did not know, so that He might humble you and test you, to do you good in the end.
verses.comment: Repeats earlier references to God’s providence and purpose.

verses.text: Beware lest you say in your heart, ‘My power and the strength of my hand have gotten me this wealth.’
verses.comment: Warning against self-reliance and pride.

verses.text: But you shall remember the LORD your God, for it is He who gives you power to get wealth, that He may confirm His covenant which He swore to your fathers, as it is this day.
verses.comment: God as the ultimate source of provision and blessing.

verses.text: And if you ever forget the LORD your God and go after other gods and serve them and worship them, I testify against you today that you shall surely perish.
verses.comment: Idolatry leads to destruction; this is a formal warning.

verses.text: Like the nations that the LORD destroys before you, so you shall perish, because you would not listen to the voice of the LORD your God.
verses.comment: Israel’s fate would be like the Canaanites if they abandon God.
